intro: Lastrea barbigera, commonly known as the hairy lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with densely packed, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Lastrea barbigera is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
